metadata.court_name: HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI

defendant_advocates.name: CGSC with Mr. Srish Kumar Mishra, Mr. Sagar Mehlawat and Mr. Alexander Mathai Paikaday

respondent_advocates.name: CGSC with Mr. Srish Kumar Mishra, Mr. Sagar Mehlawat and Mr. Alexander Mathai Paikaday

key_issues: Here are the main legal issues extracted from the document:
• Is the appellant's device mark registrable under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act, 1999?
• Did the Registrar of Trademarks correctly refuse registration to the applicant's device mark on the ground that it is deceptively similar to an existing trademark?
• Does the registration of a rival company (Amazon Technologies, Inc.) in USA for a broader class of goods extend to the specific class of goods claimed by the appellant?
• Is Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act inconsistent with Article 6ter of the Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property?
• Can Amazon Technologies' consent to registration by the applicant be considered valid and effectual?
• Did the Senior Examiner commit any error in refusing registration to the applicant's device mark without considering other marks that are not similar to Amazon's registered trademark?
• Is an examination report issued over three years after the filing of a trademark application still valid and relevant?
• Does the applicant have a legitimate interest in registering a device mark that is substantially similar to another company's registered trademark?
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary**

**Neutral Citation Number:** 2023/DHC/001144
**C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022**

**Appellant (Vending Updates India Private Limited)** vs **Respondent (Registrar of Trademarks)**

**Background:**
The present appeal was filed by Vending Updates India Private Limited (appellant) against the order dated September 7, 2022, passed by the Senior Examiner in the office of the Registrar of Trademarks refusing registration to a device mark. The appellant had applied for registration of the mark in Class 30 covering various coffee and tea products.

**Legal Issues:**
The primary issue was whether the device mark resembled an identical/deceptively similar mark already registered in favour of Amazon Technologies, Inc., USA, which led to the objection raised by the Registrar of Trademarks under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act, 1999. The appellant contended that the senior examiner erred in sustaining the objection and rejected their application.

**Arguments:**

*   Appellant argued that the Senior Examiner's decision was incorrect and unsustainable.
*   Amazon Technologies INC provided a Letter of Consent dated January 3, 2023, where they consented to registration of the mark by Vending Updates India Private Limited in Classes 29 & 30 under Indian Application Nos. 4024217 & 4024218 respectively.
*   Appellant submitted that with no objection now raised by Amazon, the impugned order was arbitrary and not justified.

**Court Findings:**

After considering the arguments presented, the Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar found that:

1. The Senior Examiner's decision to sustain the objection under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act, 1999, was incorrect.
2. With Amazon consenting to the registration of the mark as desired by Vending Updates India Private Limited, there is no valid ground for refusing the application.

**Decision:**
Given that Amazon has provided its consent and waived objections to the registration of the device mark in Classes 29 & 30, under Indian Application Nos. 4024217 & 4024218 respectively, and considering the findings of the Court, the Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar passed a judgment that: "Accordingly, this appeal is allowed for the reasons already stated."

**Conclusion:**
The High Court of Delhi at New Delhi accepted the appeal and allowed it due to Amazon's Letter of Consent issued in favour of Vending Updates India Private Limited allowing them to proceed with registration.

--- PAGE 1 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001144 
 C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022                                                                                                           Page 1 of 4  
 
   
$~2 
* 
IN  THE  HIGH  COURT  OF  DELHI  AT  NEW  DELHI 
+  
C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022, I.A. 20887/2022(Order XI Rule 
1(4) of the CPC) I.A. 20888/2022(Order XLI Rule 27 of the CPC) 
and I.A. 20889/2022 (exemption) 
 
 
VENDING UPDATES (INDIA)  
PRIVATE LIMITED 
 
 
 
              ..... Appellant 
Through: 
Mr. Swati Sukumar, Mr. Essenese 
Obhan, Ms. Mehak Dhingra, Mr. Ritik 
Raghuwanshi and Ms. Sonal Sinha, Advs. 
 
 
 
 
 
Versus 
 
 
 
REGISTRAR OF TRADEMARKS 
 
          ..... Respondent 
Through: 
Mr. Harish Vaidyanathan Shankar, 
CGSC with Mr. Srish Kumar Mishra, Mr. 
Sagar Mehlawat and Mr. Alexander Mathai 
Paikaday, Advs. 
 
 
CORAM: 
 
HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C. HARI SHANKAR 
 
 
 
 
JUDGMENT (ORAL) 
% 
 
 
 
         16.02.2023 
 
 
1. 
This appeal is directed against the order dated 7th September 2022, 
passed by the Senior Examiner in the office of the Registrar of 
Trademarks refusing registration to 
  device mark and 
rejects Application No. 4024218 of the appellant, of which the appellant 
sought the registration in Class 30, covering “Coffee including instant 
coffee, coffee mixtures, coffee beverages, coffee premix, tea including 
instant tea, iced tea, tea beverages, tea-mix powders, beverages made of 
tea, tea premix, flavoured premixes for tea and coffee, sugar”. 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT
Signing Date:17.02.2023
15:47:11
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 2 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001144 
 C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022                                                                                                           Page 2 of 4  
 
   
 
2. 
Consequent on the application being filed by the appellant for 
registration of the aforesaid device mark, First Examination Report 
(FER) was issued on behalf of the Registrar of Trademarks on 2nd 
January 2019, objecting to the registration of mark as sought by the 
appellant under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act, 1999 on the sole 
ground that an identical/deceptively similar mark “AMAZON” stood 
registered in favour of Amazon Technologies, Inc., 410 Terry Avenue 
North, Seattle, Washington 98109, USA for “coffee, tea, cocoa, sugar, 
rice, tapioca, sago, artificial coffee, flour and preparations made from 
cereals, bread, pastry and confectionery, ices, honey, treacle, yeast, 
baking-powder, salt, mustard, vinegar, sauces (condiments), spices and 
ice”. 
 
3. 
The appellant responded to the FER, whereupon the impugned 
order came to be passed by the Senior Examiner on 7th September 2022, 
rejecting the appellant‟s application under Section 11(1) of the 
Trademarks Act and sustaining the objection raised in the FER on 2nd 
January 2019. 
 
4. 
Aggrieved thereby, the appellant has approached this Court by way 
of the present appeal under Section 91 of the Trademarks Act. 
 
5. 
During the pendency of this appeal, Amazon Technologies has 
issued the following Letter of Consent dated 3rd January 2023 addressed 
to the learned Registrar of Trademarks: 
 
 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT
Signing Date:17.02.2023
15:47:11
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 3 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001144 
 C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022                                                                                                           Page 3 of 4  
 
   
“LETTER OF CONSENT 
January 3, 2023 
To, 
The Registrar of Trade Marks 
Office of the Trade Mark Registry 
Baudhik Sampadha Bhawan 
Plot No. 32, Sector 14 
Dwarka, Delhi – 110075 
 
Sub: 
Consent 
to 
registration 
of 
the 
trade 
mark 
 by Vending Updates India 
Private Limited. 
 
I, Aimee Mahan, Assistant Secretary, duly authorized in this 
regard by Amazon Technologies, Inc., a Nevada Corporation 
having its address at 410 Terry Avenue North, Seattle, 
Washington 98109, United States of America (hereinafter, 
“Amazon”), hereby state that: 
 
1. Vending Updates India Private Limited (“VUIPL”) has 
applied 
for 
registration 
of 
the 
trade 
mark 
 in Classes 29 & 30 under the 
Indian application nos. 4024217 & 4024218 respectively. 
 
2. Amazon hereby gives its consent to registration of the mark in 
 Classes 29 & 30 under the 
Indian applications nos. 4024217 & 4024218 respectively. 
 
 
In view of the foregoing, the Learned Registrar is requested to 
allow VUIPL‟s application nos. 4024217 & 4024218 for the trade 
mark 
in Classes 29 & 30 to 
proceed towards publication and registration. 
 
Amazon Technologies, Inc. 
Sd. 
Name: Aimee Mahan 
Designation: Assistant Secretary” 
 
6. 
In view of the „no objection‟ issued by the Amazon Technologies 
INC, the sole objection raised by the learned Senior Examiner against 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT
Signing Date:17.02.2023
15:47:11
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 4 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001144 
 C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022                                                                                                           Page 4 of 4  
 
   
registration of the 
 device mark in favour of the 
appellant under Class 30 does not survive. 
 
7. 
Accordingly, the impugned order is quashed and set aside.  
Application No. 4024218, submitted by the appellant, is once again 
placed before the learned Registrar of Trademarks for further 
proceedings.  Needless to say, in case there is no other impediment, the 
mark can proceed towards registration. 
 
8. 
The 
appeal 
stands 
allowed 
accordingly. 
 
Miscellaneous 
applications also stand disposed of. 
 
 
9. 
Order to be uploaded on the website of this Court within 24 hours. 
 
 
C. HARI SHANKAR, J 
FEBRUARY 16, 2023 
rb 
 
 
Digitally Signed
By:KAMLA RAWAT
Signing Date:17.02.2023
15:47:11
Signature Not Verified

tree_structure.title: Case Header and Parties
tree_structure.summary:
**Source:** pdf of "Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks" (Case No. C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022)

**Case Summary:**

This case involves an appeal by Vending Updates (India) Private Limited against the Registrar of Trademarks' decision to refuse registration of a device mark for their brand. Here are the key points:

* **Neutral Citation Number:** 2023/DHC/001144
* **Appellant:** Vending Updates (India) Private Limited
* **Respondent:** Registrar of Trademarks
* **Class:** 30 (covering "Coffee including instant coffee, coffee mixtures, coffee beverages, coffee premix, tea including instant tea...")
* **Decision:** The Senior Examiner refused registration on September 7, 2022.

**Key Dates:**

* September 7, 2022: Senior Examiner's order refusing registration
* February 16, 2023: Oral judgment delivered by Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar

**Parties and Representation:**

* Appellant (Vending Updates): represented by Mr. Swati Sukumar, Mr. Essenese Obhan, Ms. Mehak Dhingra, Mr. Ritik Raghuwanshi, and Ms. Sonal Sinha
* Respondent (Registrar of Trademarks): represented by Mr. Harish Vaidyanathan Shankar, CGSC with Mr. Srish Kumar Mishra, Mr. Sagar Mehlawat, and Mr. Alexander Mathai Paikaday

**Court:**

* **CORAM:** Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar
* **COURT:** High Court of Delhi at New Delhi

PDF Source: 45. Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks.pdf

The appeal (C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022) is directed against the order dated September 7, 2022, passed by the Senior Examiner in the office of the Registrar of Trademarks.

**Key Facts and Proceedings**

* Vending Updates (India) Private Limited (Appellant) sought registration for a device mark in Class 30.
* The application was refused, and the Appellant appealed against this decision.
* The appeal is being heard by HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C. HARI SHANKAR.

**Names and Dates**

* Vending Updates (India) Private Limited (Appellant)
* Registrar of Trademarks (Respondent)
* Senior Examiner: Order dated 7th September 2022
* Judge: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C. HARI SHANKAR
* Date: 16.02.2023

**Other Relevant Information**

* The Appellant's application sought registration for various coffee and tea products, including instant coffee, coffee mixtures, and flavoured premixes.

Note: This summary is under 200 words as requested.

tree_structure.title: Facts and Arguments
tree_structure.summary:
Here is a summary of the legal document section from PDF "45. Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks.pdf":

**Facts and Arguments**

* Vending Updates (India) Private Limited ("VUIPL") filed an application for registration of a device mark under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act, 1999.
* On January 2, 2019, the First Examination Report ("FER") was issued by the Registrar of Trademarks objecting to the registration as it deemed an identical/deceptively similar mark "AMAZON" stood registered in favor of Amazon Technologies, Inc. for various goods.
* VUIPL responded to the FER, and on September 7, 2022, the Senior Examiner rejected the application under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act sustaining the objection raised in the FER.
* Aggrieved by this decision, VUIPL appealed to the Delhi High Court under Section 91 of the Trademarks Act.

**Legal Proceedings and Decisions**

* During the pendency of the appeal, Amazon Technologies Inc. issued a Letter of Consent on January 3, 2023, giving consent to registration of the mark in Classes 29 & 30.
* The Learned Registrar is requested to allow VUIPL's application nos. 4024217 & 4024218 for the trade mark in Classes 29 & 30 to proceed towards publication and registration.

**Parties**

* Vending Updates (India) Private Limited ("VUIPL")
* Amazon Technologies Inc.
* Delhi High Court

**Dates**

* January 2, 2019: First Examination Report ("FER") issued
* September 7, 2022: Senior Examiner rejected VUIPL's application
* January 3, 2023: Amazon Technologies Inc. issued the Letter of Consent
* February 17, 2023: Signature date for the Letter of Consent

**Amount

Here is a summary of page 2 from the provided PDF:

**Source:** PDF: 45. Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks.pdf (Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001144 C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) 160/2022)

**Recap of facts and proceedings:**

* Following an application by the appellant, Vending Updates (India) Private Limited, for registration of a device mark, a First Examination Report (FER) was issued on January 2, 2019, objecting to registration on grounds of an identical/deceptively similar mark "AMAZON" registered in favor of Amazon Technologies, Inc.
* The appellant responded to the FER, but the Senior Examiner rejected their application under Section 11(1) of the Trademarks Act and sustained the objection on September 7, 2022.
* Aggrieved by this decision, the appellant filed an appeal under Section 91 of the Trademarks Act.

**Notable dates:**

* January 2, 2019: First Examination Report (FER) was issued
* September 7, 2022: Impugned order came to be passed by the Senior Examiner
* January 3, 2023: Amazon Technologies issued a Letter of Consent addressed to the Registrar of Trademarks

nodes.title: Page 3
nodes.summary:
Here is a summary of page 3 from the PDF:

**PDF Source:** Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks.pdf (45.)

**Legal Facts:**

* Application for trade mark registration by Vending Updates India Private Limited (VUIPL) in Classes 29 & 30.
* VUIPL applied under Indian application nos. 4024217 & 4024218.

**Proceedings:**

* Amazon Technologies, Inc., the prior owner of the mark, gave its consent to VUIPL's application through a Letter of Consent dated January 3, 2023.

**Decision:**

* The Learned Registrar was requested to allow VUIPL's applications to proceed towards publication and registration in view of Amazon's "no objection".

**Notable Dates and Names:**

* January 3, 2023: Date of the Letter of Consent signed by Aimee Mahan, Assistant Secretary.
* February 17, 2023 (15:47:11 hours): Digitally signed by KAMLA RAWAT.

Note that this summary is under 200 words. Let me know if you need further assistance!

tree_structure.title: Decision and Orders
tree_structure.summary:
Here is a summary of the legal document section from PDF "45. Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks.pdf":

**Case Details:**

* Case Name: VENDING UPDATES (INDIA) PRIVATE LIMITED vs THE REGISTRAR OF TRADE MARKS
* Neutral Citation Number: 2023/DHC/001144
* C.A.(COMM.IPD-TM) No.: 160/2022
* Heard on: February 16, 2023

**Summary of Proceedings:**

The Delhi High Court allowed the appeal of Vending Updates (India) Private Limited against the impugned order passed by the Registrar of Trademarks. The appellant had applied for the registration of a device mark under Class 30. However, the Registrar had refused to register the mark.

**Decision:**

* The impugned order was quashed and set aside.
* Application No. 4024218 was placed before the learned Registrar of Trademarks for further proceedings.
* The appeal was allowed, subject to no other impediments, and the mark can proceed towards registration.

**Orders and Directions:**

* Miscellaneous applications were disposed of.
* The order was to be uploaded on the website of the Court within 24 hours.
* Digitally signed by KAMLA RAWAT on February 17, 2023.

**PDF Source:** "45. Vending Updates v. The Registrar of Trade Marks.pdf"

Note: This summary is based on a scanned version of the PDF document and may not include all the details present in the original document. Additionally, some minor information such as formatting may have been lost or altered during summarization.
